DOC.brief_summary: An outpatient study evaluate safety efficacy cariprazine adjunct Antidepressant Therapy ( ADT ) patient Major Depressive Disorder ( MDD ) inadequate response antidepressant alone . This clinical study compare cariprazine + ADT placebo + ADT outpatient diagnosis MDD inadequate response ADT current episode . The study consist approximately 2 week screen washout follow 8 week double-blind treatment follow 1 week safety follow-up .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Efficacy Cariprazine Adjunctive Antidepressant Therapy Major Depressive Disorder
DOC.criteria: Male female outpatient 18 65 year age , inclusive Currently meet Diagnostic Statistical Manual Mental Disorders , Fourth Edition , Text Revision ( DSMIVTR ) criteria moderate severe MDD Current major depressive episode least 8 week exceed 24 month duration Ongoing inadequate response protocol allow ADT Principal DSMIVTRbased diagnosis axis I disorder , MDD , Women pregnant , plan become pregnant breastfeed study practice reliable contraception continue study History meeting DSMIVTR criterion : 1 . Depressive episode psychotic catatonic feature 2 . Manic , hypomanic mixed episode , include bipolar disorder substance induce manic , hypomanic mixed episode 3 . Schizophrenia , schizoaffective , psychotic disorder 4 . Obsessivecompulsive disorder 5 . Bulimia anorexia nervosa 6 . Dementia , amnesic , cognitive disorder 7 . Mental retardation Patients consider suicide risk
